metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5060 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the XPM imagerendering function of SDL2_image 2.0.4. A specially crafted XPM image cancause an integer overflow in the colorhash function, allocating too smallof a buffer. This buffer can then be written out of bounds, resulting in aheap overflow, ultimately ending in code execution. An attacker can displaya specially crafted image to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5060` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.5+dfsg1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in esm-apps/jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.5+dfsg1-1').
